pr_title: Add support for JOIN USING statements

timeline.bodyText: Is it really safe to cast to Table here? What if left or right is a sub query?
timeline.author: kovrus

replies.bodyText: Not safe, I will now add tests, like the one #9551 , which will highlight in catastrophic form exactly this :)
replies.author: marregui

timeline.message: Add less trivial tests and account for cases where left/right are not Tables

timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText:
Please also revert these removals. It causes noise that is unrelated to the change of the PR.
I know the IDE bugs you about it, but for tests it doesn't matter and it is usually annoying to re-add it once any of the methods tell the IDE that they throw something.

replies.bodyText:
My bad, I was getting blinded by the yellow column in the IDE, which hid some red.
I have seen people treat warnings as errors in other lives.
replies.author: marregui

timeline.bodyText:
This instanceof handling in this method might be easy to forget to update in case we add new relations.
I like the solution you had in the first commit better. Was there a reason why you choose to go with this instead?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: I like the original commit better too.
replies.author: marregui

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if using randomization is justified here. I think it would be easier to understand if we tested the different scenarios explicitly.

timeline.message:
Add support for JOIN USING statements

An alternative to JOIN ON, when the column name(s) are the same in
both relations.

e.g. SELECT * FROM t1 JOIN t2 USING (col1, col2)
     SELECT * FROM t1 JOIN t2 ON t1.col1 = t2.col1 AND t1.col2 = t2.col2
